content.description:
This ascends the wall above and to the right of the Second Terrace. Traverse around and right on the 3rd class ledge, past 'Pinacoidal Cleavage'.

Rap 'Sweet Crack Center' to get back to the Second Terrace. To descend from the Second Terrace, move down to the top of 'Clast von Bulow'.

This is the right most of the 'sweet cracks', which takes a little work to get to. From the center crack, you must traverse and downclimb to the start.

Then head up the short corner into the fun, easy hand crack to the top. Traverse back left to the anchor in the far corner.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3", emphasis on fat fingers and thin hands.
content.location:
This ascends the wall above and to the right of the Second Terrace. Traverse around and right on the 3rd class ledge, past 'Pinacoidal Cleavage'.

Rap 'Sweet Crack Center' to get back to the Second Terrace. To descend from the Second Terrace, move down to the top of 'Clast von Bulow'.

content.description:
This ascends the wall above and to the right of the Second Terrace. Traverse around and right on the 3rd class ledge, past 'Pinacoidal Cleavage'.

Rap 'Sweet Crack Center' to get back to the Second Terrace. To descend from the Second Terrace, move down to the top of 'Clast von Bulow'.

This is the first of the 3 cracks above the second terrace and past Cobb Route. Avoid the rotten rock to the left. Line travels over an entertaining roof, trending up and left to the anchor shared by all 3 'Sweet Crack' routes.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3". Offset nuts are sweet. Tricams?
content.location:

Rap 'Sweet Crack Center' to get back to the Second Terrace. To descend from the Second Terrace, move down to the top of 'Clast von Bulow'.

The center
content.location:
This ascends the wall above and to the right of the Second Terrace. Traverse around and right on the 3rd class ledge, past 'Pinacoidal Cleavage'.

Rap 'Sweet Crack Center' to get back to the Second Terrace. To descend from the Second Terrace, move down to the top of 'Clast von Bulow'.

content.description:
Tim Laughlin doesn't just put up great hard 11's. This is a case in point.

Sustained, perfect hands and fingers up the arete with great exposure and good pro.

Great way to get to the top and work Busload and Amused.
content.location: From the second Terrace, the exposed right hand arete split with a sweet finger to hand crack. Rap from anchors shared with 'Busload of Faith'.

climbs.name: Easily Amused
climbs.fa: Tim Laughlin, Todd Burrill, Rich James

content.description:
Another hard Tim Laughlin route!

In between the arete and 'Busload of Faith' there is a steep handcrack. Harder than it looks, follow it up to a ledge and then up to the finish shared with 'Busload'.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3". Doubles (+?) fingers and hands. Nuts are awesome.
content.location: To the right of Busload, just to the left of the arete. Rap from the bolted anchor.

content.description:
This ascends the wall above and to the right of the Second Terrace. Traverse around and right on the 3rd class ledge, past 'Pinacoidal Cleavage'.

Rap 'Sweet Crack Center' to get back to the Second Terrace. To descend from the Second Terrace, move down to the top of 'Clast von Bulow'.

This one star route ascends the first crack system in the shallow corner you get to on the traverse. Climb up and trend right to the large ledge.
content.location:
This ascends the wall above and to the right of the Second Terrace. Traverse around and right on the 3rd class ledge, past 'Pinacoidal Cleavage'.

Rap 'Sweet Crack Center' to get back to the Second Terrace. To descend from the Second Terrace, move down to the top of 'Clast von Bulow'.

content.description: This line is really awesome fun, but somewhat sandbagged. (Elevation?). On the Second Terrace, after climbing the first 2 pitches of the Regular Route, move to the right and find a hand crack in the middle of the narrow face. 15 feet up the crack peters out, the exciting face climbing continues through 8 bolts. Stout!
content.location: After climbing the first 2 pitches of The Regular Route, instead of climbing the crack in the corner (pitch 3 of RR) move right (10'?) to a sweet handcrack. It can be hard to see the bolts above, but they are there.

content.description: On the far right side of the First Terrace you will find a flaring crack ascending the blunt arete. Lousy protection leads up the crack and face. The climb really goes nowhere, as it ends on the upper section of the second terrace, where you have to climb yet another route to either get to bolted anchors or the top. More of an adventure then a route, one for the bold. Or bored? The only reason this route is mentioned is for those who wonder where that crack leads. Ugh.
content.protection: Double rack to 2". Gear is hard to find, and hard to place.
content.location: Climb the first 2/3 of the regular route. Instead of traversing into the corner across the terrace, head up through the poorly protected flaring crack. Best way to finish is to climb "Sweet Crack Left" and rap back to the Second Terrace. From there rap to the ground from the anchor for Clast von Bulow at the base of the terrace.

content.description: Another great Tim Laughlin route. Start as for the Regular Route, but instead of traversing across the First Terrace, head up the short left facing corner above which there are 2 bolts through fun knobs leading into a sweet crack. The moves to the first bolt are....bold. It can be difficult to see the bolts from below.
content.protection: Standard rack .3 to 3". Tricams and offset nuts sing. Bolted anchor. 2 60m ropes required to rap
content.location: Start as for the regular route at the base of the toe. Where the Regular Route cuts left onto the Terrace, move straight up into the shallow left facing corner.
